Articles.Content: Lately i've been having afew problems with crashing when I add afew more parts from a mod, and i'm wondering what the upper limit for a stable KSP experience is. Currently I have around 430 parts and it will crash on occasion.

Has nothing to do with part count bud, and everything to do with how much system memory KSP is using. As it stands KSP is a 32bit program, so it will only ever use around 3.5gb of memory...after that you gonna crash.

A couple things you can do to help:

Lower rendering speed to 'fastest'

Put texture on 'Half Res'

and go through and and all mods/parts you have and delete anything you dont actualy use.

One of my KSP installs has 640 some-odd parts and is very stable (thanks to the stock and KW texture reduction mod)

Yup. ^^This.

I have MANY mods, and many are large parts packs. I think I run about 850 parts, after cutting all the parts I dont use from the install.

The biggest single cut can be made to the Squad (stock) folder...ESPECIALLY the IVA views and props: those alone will cut the Squad folder by about 270MB.

I never use the IVA views, whether stock OR mods. I havent tried the new re-textures yet.

My computer gets really laggy at about 300 parts, whether its a single ship, or multiple ships, even after disabling and lowering most of the graphics settings to their lowest, though, but I've never had a game actually crash, even with my Gamedata folder as high as 2.7GB...Gamedata folder DOES seem to affect RAM usage, but its not a linear thing. (ie cutting 1GB from your Gamedata does NOT mean youre gonna cut RAM by the same amount)

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/51361-0-21-Squad-Texture-Reduction-Pack-B9-and-KW-Packs-also

Should give this thread a look if you want high part count total, great tools for reducing memory footprint.

@Stone...have ya tried a big ship, 300+ parts, since 0.22 dropped? It seems to load higher part count craft with less lag now. Ive got my main station almost back to its pre-0.22 glory and its no where near as laggy trying to dock to it as before.

No, I havent..I've only been playing stock career mode with 0.22 so far...Quite difficult...lol

Biggest rocket so far is only about 80 parts (3 stage rocket), and a manned 97 part sea/land/air rover. Basically looks like a plane, but can do 250m/s in the air, 60-70m/s on the ground, and 8m/s in the water.

I HAVE noticed I've been able to run full screen, and up my graphics settings a little with practically no lag in 0.22...But then I have been running mods with 0.21, and had little "vanilla" play time with 0.21, so I cant really compare 0.22 vs 0.21 that way.

I'm still updating my spreadsheet of over 180 mods...When thats all done, I'll be installing and trying most of them with 0.22.
